reach.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if someone or something reaches a particular point in their development or in a process or competition, they get to that point
reach.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
I had reached the point where I was earning a good salary.
The kids have reached the age when they can care for themselves.
reach.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people often use get to rather than reach:
The kids have got to the age where they can care for themselves.
reach.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if something reaches a particular rate, amount etc, it increases until it is at that rate or amount
reach.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: By 2008, that figure is expected to reach 7 million.
wind speeds reaching up to 180 mph
Prices rose steadily to reach record levels.
reach.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to agree on something or decide something after a lot of discussion or thought
reach.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The theatre has reached an agreement with striking actors.
It took the jury three days to reach a verdict.
The talks will continue until a conclusion is reached.
reach.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to move your arm in order to touch or lift something with your hand
reach.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
He reached down to help her to her feet.
Luisa reached out her hand to stroke the cat.
reach.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to touch something by stretching out your arm
reach.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: It’s no good – I can’t reach.
She’s too small to reach the table.
reach.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to get something from a high place by stretching up your arm
reach.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: She fell while reaching down a vase from the top shelf.
reach.translation[0].definitions[6].type: intransitive always + adverb/preposition, transitive not in progressive
reach.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to be big enough, long enough etc to get to a particular point
reach.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: The phone lead isn’t long enough to reach the bedroom.
a skirt that reaches halfway down her legs
Her hair reaches down to her waist.
reach as far as something/reach down to something
reach.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: We reached London late at night.
The pyramids can be reached by public transport.
reach.translation[0].definitions[7].note: In everyday English, people often use get to rather than reach:
We got to the airport just in time.
You can get to the pyramids by public transport.
reach.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: if you reach someone, you succeed in speaking to them on the telephone
reach.translation[0].definitions[8].exam: I can probably reach him on his mobile.
reach.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: if a message, television programme etc reaches a lot of people, they hear it or see it
reach.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: Cable TV reaches a huge audience.
reach.translation[0].definitions[10].def: if information reaches you, you hear about it
reach.translation[0].definitions[10].exa: The news reached us in Lahore.
reach.translation[0].definitions[11].def: to succeed in making someone understand or accept what you tell them
reach.translation[0].definitions[11].exa: I just can’t seem to reach Ed anymore.
reach.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: if someone or something reaches a particular point in their development or in a process or competition, they get to that point
reach.translation[0].note_box[0].section: I’ve reached the point in my life where I need a new challenge.
He eventually reached the level of Senior Instructor.
The payments will be made until the child reaches college age.
Some of these power stations are reaching the end of their useful life.
It takes ten years for these fish to reach maturity.
Most players don’t reach their peak until their late twenties.
reach.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 3: to agree on something or decide something after a lot of discussion or thought
reach.translation[0].note_box[1].section: I hope that they reach a decision soon.
We reached the conclusion that the man had been murdered.
The jury failed to reach a verdict.
Substantial progress was made toward reaching an agreement.
The experts seem unable to reach consensus on this point.
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[0: You  reach a city, country, or other place
The climbers reached the summit of the mountain
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[1: You should reach there around 945 am
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[2: She finally reached home late at night
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[3: You arrive in a city or country
We arrived in London at 2 am
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[4: You arrive at a place such as a house, hotel, or airport
They arrived at the airport at 1030
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[6: Call me when you arrive there
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[7: You get to a city, country, or other place
We got to London at 2 am
We got to the airport at 1030
reach.translation[0].note_box[2].items[9: Call me when you get there
reach.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the distance that you can stretch out your arm to touch something
reach.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Keep chemicals out of the reach of children.
Keep a glass of water within reach.
reach.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the limit of someone’s power or ability to do something
reach.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He lives in Paraguay, well beyond the reach of the British authorities.
reach.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to increase or improve to a particular level or amount
reach.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Sales are expected to reach 1.2 billion euros this year.
reach.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to succeed in making someone see an advertisement, hear about a product etc
reach.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The company has an opportunity to reach new customers.
reach.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: to succeed in speaking to someone or giving them a message by telephone
reach.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: He tried three times to reach Mr. Gumbel at his hotel.
reach.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: to succeed in making an agreement, decision etc
reach.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: The company failed to reach a labor agreement with the Union.
reach.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: the number of people that see or hear an advertisement, television programme etc
reach.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The network has a reach of about 4 million homes.
reach.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: within or beyond what someone can afford
reach.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The software is within the reach of the average business user.
